item.title: Palabra del día en inglés: ‘bestow’
item.description: Esta palabra ha aparecido en 73 artículos en NYTimes.com en el último año. ¿Puedes usarla en una frase?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Word of the Day: bestow
item.description: This word has appeared in 73 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: ‘The Beatles Anthology,’ Plus 9 Things to Watch on TV This Week
item.description: The remastered documentary series will be released, and we watch some reader recommendations, including “The Gone” and “Dark.”
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez

item.title: No Corrections: Nov. 24, 2025
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, Nov. 24, 2025.

item.title: Trade Chaos Causes Businesses to Rethink Their Relationship With the U.S.
item.description: From Sweden to Brazil, six small companies talk about how they are communicating with their U.S. customers amid uncertainty over Trump’s changing tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Nadav Gavrielov

media:content.media:credit: Cesar Rodriguez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Víctor Feliu at his chocolate company in Mexico. The changing rules for sending goods to the United States have forced him to pause his U.S. shipments.

item.title: Quote of the Day: A Belgian Region’s Experiment With Democracy, and Trust
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Monday, November 24, 2025.

item.title: How One German Toymaker Made Money Despite U.S. Tariffs
item.description: A combination of strategic planning, good timing and a long-awaited product helped the maker of electronic story boxes weather the onset of tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Melissa Eddy

media:content.media:description: A popular audio player, Toniebox. Toy sales in the United States are up, despite new tariffs, which contributed to, on average, a 4 percent increase in retail prices, according to Circana, a marketing research firm.

item.title: ‘It: Welcome to Derry’ Season 1, Episode 5 Recap: Search and Destroy
item.description: Gen. Shaw sends troops into the sewage tunnels under Derry. The children send themselves there, too. Bad idea in both cases.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins

media:content.media:description: Dick (Chris Chalk ) saw something in those tunnels. It seemed mostly to be in his head.

item.title: Jamil Abdullah Al-Amin, Black Power Activist Known as H. Rap Brown, Dies at 82
item.description: A charismatic orator in the 1960s, he called for armed resistance to white oppression. As a Muslim cleric, he was convicted of murder in 2000 and died in detention.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vitello

media:content.media:description: Jamil Abdullah Al-Amin, then known as H. Rap Brown, in 1967. At the time, he was chairman of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee.

item.title: Morgan Geyser, Convicted in ‘Slender Man’ Stabbing, Is Captured After Fleeing
item.description: The woman, Morgan Geyser, was taken into custody a day after she left a group home in Wisconsin. The police said she cut off a monitoring bracelet.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra E. Petri

media:content.media:description: Morgan Geyser at a court appearance in January.

item.title: Lee Tamahori, Director of Film Voted New Zealand’s Best, Dies at 75
item.description: He reimagined “Once Were Warriors,” a novel about a Maori family, as a film that became a worldwide phenomenon. He went on to direct Hollywood movies.
item.dc:creator: Alex Traub

media:content.media:description: A scene from the 1994 film “Once Were Warriors,” directed by Lee Tamahori. It became the highest-grossing film in New Zealand’s history.

item.title: Former News Anchor Sentenced to 10 Years in Prison for Pandemic Fraud
item.description: The former anchor, Stephanie Hockridge, who once worked for a Phoenix station, participated in an elaborate scheme that illegally obtained more than $63 million, prosecutors said.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra E. Petri
item.category: Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (2020)

item.title: Israel Military Commanders Punished Over Hamas Attack Mistakes
item.description: About a dozen people were told they face dismissal or discipline for mistakes tied to the deadly Hamas-led attack that set off the war in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Ephrat Livni

media:content.media:credit: Amit Elkayam for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Lt. Gen. Eyal Zamir at a ceremony for soldiers and security personnel last month in Jerusalem.

item.title: Top U.S. Military Officer to Visit Caribbean as Trump Pressures Venezuela
item.description: Gen. Dan Caine is making the trip as President Trump is said to have approved plans for covert action in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Gen. Dan Caine, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, will visit troops stationed in the Caribbean this week ahead of Thanksgiving.

item.title: U.S. Introduces New Female Crash-Test Dummy Standards
item.description: A female crash-test dummy to replace an outdated model largely based on male proportions would improve safety for women, who face higher fatality and injury risks on the road, officials said.
item.dc:creator: Adeel Hassan

media:content.media:description: A THOR-05F female crash-test dummy in Farmington Hills, Mich.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Nov. 24, 2025
item.description: Zhou Zhang brings us into her circle.
item.dc:creator: Sam Corbin

item.title: Mamdani’s Meeting With Trump Scrambled the MAGA-Sphere
item.description: Prominent conservative influencers had different interpretations as they processed the meeting on podcasts and in social media posts.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Taylor Pemberton

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The meeting between Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect of New York City, and President Trump was not as explosive as some expected. Online, MAGA influencers and others on the right did not have a united response.

item.title: Trump to End Temporary Protected Status for Somalis
item.description: About 700 Somali immigrants are currently allowed to live and work in the United States under a program for people fleeing countries in turmoil.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs

media:content.media:credit: Jenn Ackerman for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Two women walk through a store at the Karmel Mall, a Somali shopping center, in Minneapolis, Minn.

item.title: Donald Glover Says He Had a Stroke That Prompted Him to Cancel His Tour in 2024
item.description: The rapper and actor, who performed in Los Angeles on Saturday, said doctors had also discovered a hole in his heart, prompting him to cancel his world tour.
item.dc:creator: Derrick Bryson Taylor
item.category: Tyler, the Creators Camp Flog Gnaw

media:content.media:description: Donald Glover performing as Childish Gambino during Tyler, The Creator’s “Camp Flog Gnaw Carnival” at Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles on Saturday.

item.title: Can the World Move On Without the U.S.? G20 Leaders Gave It a Shot.
item.description: With the United States boycotting the summit, other nations sought to strike new deals, and some took a tougher tone with President Trump.
item.dc:creator: John Eligon

media:content.media:description: President Cyril Ramaphosa of South Africa at the opening plenary session of the G20 summit on Saturday.

item.title: Denmark’s Migration Model
item.description: The country is getting attention for its tough asylum policies. Can they serve as a bulwark against the far right?
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold

media:content.media:credit: Charlotte de la Fuente for The New York Times

item.title: ‘Gruesome Playground Injuries’ Review: Does It Hurt?
item.description: Kara Young and Nicholas Braun star in the Off Broadway revival of Rajiv Joseph’s two-hander about best friends on parallel paths to self-destruction.
item.dc:creator: Laura Collins-Hughes

media:content.media:description: At the Lucille Lortel Theater, the two-time Tony Award winner Kara Young, left, plays Kayleen opposite the “Succession” alum Nicholas Braun as Doug.

item.title: Estos chocolateros han encontrado una forma deliciosa de ayudar a la Amazonía
item.description: Una nueva generación de chocolateros artesanales de Brasil está creando tabletas con “identidad”. Y también están ayudando a conservar la selva.
item.dc:creator: Somini Sengupta and Alessandro Falco

item.title: El Reino Unido busca endurecer sus políticas para refugiados
item.description: El primer ministro Keir Starmer espera que un nuevo enfoque para las solicitudes de asilo le permita controlar un debate sobre inmigración que amenaza su gobierno. La propuesta ha provocado reacciones negativas.
item.dc:creator: Mark Landler

media:content.media:credit: Foto de consorcio por Frank Augstein
media:content.media:description: El primer ministro británico, Keir Starmer, saliendo el lunes del número 10 de Downing Street. Algunos miembros del Partido Laborista de Starmer se oponen a las nuevas restricciones a la inmigración.

item.title: Denmark Offers Lessons as Europe Toughens Up on Immigration
item.description: Like other European leaders, British Labour politicians are borrowing from Denmark’s restrictive asylum policy. One of its architects cautions that “balance” is necessary.
item.dc:creator: Jeanna Smialek, Amelia Nierenberg and Charlotte de la Fuente

media:content.media:credit: Charlotte de la Fuente for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Voting this past week in Tingbjerg, Denmark. The governing party, which has championed a stricter stance on asylum, performed badly in municipal elections.

item.title: Mother Accused of Delaying Medical Care for Daughter Who Died on Road Trip
item.description: A diabetic 10-year-old girl slipped into a coma during a trip with her family and was brought to the hospital after she had died, the authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Holpuch

item.title: The Danish Model for Immigration Crackdown
item.description: For European governments, Denmark’s hard-line immigration policy is a model for how to get a grip on contentious issue and stay in power. Our reporter Jeanna Smialek reports from Copenhagen on the the effects of the policy.
item.dc:creator: Jeanna Smialek, Katrin Bennhold, Nikolay Nikolov, Leila Medina and James Surdam

item.title: Haití celebra su primera clasificación al Mundial en 50 años
item.description: El triunfo de la selección nacional que le consiguió un puesto en la Copa dio a los haitianos de todo el mundo un respiro momentáneo de las profundas crisis de su país.
item.dc:creator: James Wagner

media:content.media:description: Aficionados en Puerto Príncipe, la capital, celebraron la derrota de Nicaragua ante Haití el martes para clasificar a la Copa Mundial de la FIFA 2026.

item.title: How a Sabotaged Ankle Monitor Ended Bolsonaro’s House Arrest
item.description: Shortly before he was expected to start serving a 27-year sentence, Brazil’s former president took a soldering iron to his tracking device.
item.dc:creator: Ana Ionova
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

media:content.media:credit: Federal District’s Secretariat for Penitentiary Administration
media:content.media:description: The damaged ankle monitor of former President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil, in a still image taken from a video released by the Federal District’s Secretariat for Penitentiary Administration.

item.title: Israel Says It Assassinated Top Hezbollah Commander in Lebanon
item.description: Escalating its attacks on the Iran-backed militant group in Lebanon, Israel killed Hezbollah’s military chief of staff in an airstrike on an apartment building.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Boxerman

media:content.media:description: Lebanese civil defense workers inspect the damage from an Israeli airstrike on an apartment building in a Dahiya, a suburban area south of Beirut.

item.title: Trump Calls Ukraine Ungrateful, Again, for U.S. Support in War With Russia
item.description: President Trump renewed his criticism of Ukraine’s government as emissaries from Kyiv and Washington met to discuss a plan to end the war.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Mpoke Bigg

media:content.media:credit: Cheriss May for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump criticized the Ukrainian government on Truth Social.

item.title: Fire Threatens Iran’s Ancient Forest, a World Heritage Site
item.description: Iran has been battling its worst drought in more than six decades. A blaze in the north has now eaten through parts of the old treasure.
item.dc:creator: Erika Solomon and Sanam Mahoozi
item.category: Destruction of Cultural Antiquities and Heritage

media:content.media:description: A forest in Iran that is part of the Hyrcanian Forests, which are “among the oldest and most biodiverse ecosystems across the globe,” an expert said.

item.title: Waymo triunfaba en San Francisco, hasta que uno de sus vehículos autónomos mató a un gato
item.description: Los taxis sin conductor se han hecho omnipresentes en la ciudad, pero se armó un revuelo cuando uno atropelló a un gato muy querido por un vecindario.
item.dc:creator: Heather Knight

item.title: Melissa Clark’s Classic Thanksgiving Turkey Recipe
item.description: In our Thanksgiving episode of Cooking 101, Melissa shares the one recipe you need for a burnished, juicy turkey.
item.dc:creator: Genevieve Ko

media:content.media:credit: David Malosh for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Barrett Washburne.
media:content.media:description: Melissa Clark’s classic Thanksgiving turkey.

item.title: Cómo los Beatles lograron enganchar a la generación X
item.description: Los jóvenes que alcanzaron la mayoría de edad a la sombra de los Fab Four se mofaban de las credenciales boomer de la banda. Los discos “Anthology”, que vuelven ahora después de 30 años, cambiaron todo eso.
item.dc:creator: Ben Sisario

item.title: Motorcyclist Dies in ‘Globe of Death’ Circus Accident in Italy
item.description: Christián Quezada Vasquez died after losing control during a stunt in which motorcyclists ride around a spherical cage, the circus company said.
item.dc:creator: Ali Watkins

media:content.media:description: Performers rehearsing inside a “Globe of Death” sphere in Rotterdam, the Netherlands, in 2015. A rider was killed during a similar stunt in Italy last week.

item.title: Zelensky Is Under Pressure from Trump and Domestically
item.description: Over nearly four years of wartime leadership, analysts say the Ukrainian leader has repeatedly played weak hands wisely. A U.S. peace plan may be his biggest test.
item.dc:creator: Cassandra Vinograd and Andrew E. Kramer

media:content.media:description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine at a French air base this month. He is seeking support from his European partners as he negotiates with the Trump administration over a U.S. peace proposal.

item.title: How to Be Grateful When You’re Struggling
item.description: Gratitude is good for you. Like, really good for you. But it’s also hard to practice.
item.dc:creator: Jodi Rudoren

item.title: As Trump’s Inquisitors Face Scrutiny, a Divisive Figure Could Play a New Role
item.description: The prosecutor running an inquiry into those who investigated President Trump has established a grand jury under Judge Aileen M. Cannon, whose scuttling of the documents case made her a White House favorite.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Savage
item.category: Federal Criminal Case Against Trump (Documents Case)
Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

media:content.media:description: Judge Aileen M. Cannon may again end up as a key player in a Trump-centric case.

item.title: Mamdani and Trump Tamp Down Fears Over National Guard in New York City
item.description: In a Sunday interview on “Meet the Press,” Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect, said he had made a forceful case to the president that troops were not needed in the city.
item.dc:creator: Emma G. Fitzsimmons

media:content.media:description: Zohran Mamdani also made it clear in his interview with Kristen Welker on “Meet the Press” that he believed President Trump was a fascist.

item.title: In an Italian Masterpiece, Art and Faith Meet
item.description: Readers respond to a guest essay about the religious feelings inspired by Fra Angelico’s painting. Also: Down times at the movies.

media:content.media:credit: Dea/G. Nimatallah/De Agostini via Getty Images

item.title: Rubio Insists U.S. Authored Ukraine Peace Plan
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio’s comments came after a group of U.S. lawmakers claimed that he said the plan was a Russian initiative, not an American proposal.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Mpoke Bigg

media:content.media:description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio speaks with Michael Waltz, the U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations, during a security council meeting on Ukraine at the United Nations headquarters in New York City in September.

item.title: Meet the Beatles, Again
item.description: A music reporter revisits the documentary that made him fall in love with the Beatles, ahead of the film’s 30th-anniversary rerelease.
item.dc:creator: Ben Sisario
item.category: Sgt Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band (Album)

item.title: The Daily’s Sunday Special: Wicked, Good?
item.description: “Wicked: For Good” is one of the biggest films of the year. Let’s talk about it.
item.dc:creator: Gilbert Cruz, Madison Malone Kircher, Kyle Buchanan, Kate LoPresti, Alex Barron, Luke Vander Ploeg, Wendy Dorr, Rowan Niemisto, Dan Powell, Marion Lozano, Elisheba Ittoop and Diane Wong

item.title: Trump Has Put the Military in an Impossible Situation
item.description: Who should take responsibility for the president’s undeclared war in the Caribbean?
item.dc:creator: David French
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

item.title: America’s Housing Crisis, in One Chart
item.description: If we want more places for people to live, we’re going to have to get more creative.
item.dc:creator: Ezra Klein

media:content.media:credit: Jesse Rieser for The New York Times

item.title: How Can Anyone Seriously Doubt Meta Is a Monopoly?
item.description: All you need is common sense.
item.dc:creator: Tim Wu

item.title: How the Elite Behave When No One Is Watching: Inside the Epstein Emails
item.description: This power elite was already used to ignoring the powerless. Redeeming a disgraced sex offender was a logical next step.
item.dc:creator: Anand Giridharadas

item.title: We’re Seeing What a No-Immigration Economy Looks Like
item.description: Making America less hospitable to newcomers will eventually make our country poorer.
item.dc:creator: Wendy Edelberg
